email.name: Workflow Template
email.subject: Action Required {{Data.Account.Name}} Invoice 30 Days Past Due

parameters.where_clause: DueDate <= '{{Data.Invoice.DueDate}}' AND Balance > 0 AND Status = 'Posted' AND AccountId = '{{Data.Account.Id}}'
Invoice.DueDate <= 'today - 30 days' AND Invoice.Balance > 0 AND Invoice.Status = 'Posted' Order By Invoice.DueDate Desc

workflow_definition.name: Apply Late Fee to all Subscriptions for Accounts > 10 Days Overdue Limit 1

workflow.name: Apply Late Fee to all Subscriptions for Accounts > 10 Days Overdue Limit 1

email.subject: Late Payment Fee Applied
email.template:
Zuora - Workflow Email Templates
 

Hello {{Data.Account.Name}},

We would like to inform you that a late payment fee has been applied to your subscription  {{Data.Subscription.Name}} due to an unpaid balance on your account. Please update your payment information or call to provide payment of {{Data.Account.Balance}}.

Thanks, 


Zuora, Inc. - Powering the subscription economy
 
Copyright © 2008-2016, Zuora Inc. All Rights Reserved.

tasks.name: Apply Late Fee - Edit to select RatePlan
Export Subscriptions tied to Late Accounts

parameters.where_clause: Subscription.Status = 'Active' AND Account.Balance > 0 AND Account.LastInvoiceDate  < 'today - 10 day' Limit 1

workflow_definition.name: Resume Subscriptions for Accounts with Zero Balance Limit 1

workflow.name: Resume Subscriptions for Accounts with Zero Balance Limit 1

email.subject: Subscription Resumed
email.template:
Zuora - Workflow Email Templates
 

Hello {{Data.Account.Name}},

We would like to inform you that your subscription, {{Data.Subscription.Name}} , has been resumed as your account balance has been paid off. Please contact support if you think there has been a mistake.

Thanks,


Zuora, Inc. - Powering the subscription economy
 
Copyright © 2008-2016, Zuora Inc. All Rights Reserved.

parameters.where_clause: Subscription.Status = 'Suspended' AND SubscriptionVersionAmendment.SuspendDate < 'today' AND Account.Balance = 0 Limit 1

workflow_definition.name: Chargebacks -> Write Off Invoice + Cancel Subscription

workflow.name: Chargebacks -> Write Off Invoice + Cancel Subscription
workflow.description: This workflow would run on a schedule and pick up invoices with a balance that have a tied chargeback refund. Those invoices are written off using InvoiceItemAdjustments and the linked Subscriptions are then cancelled.

tasks.name: Pull Refunds from Chargebacks where Invoice Balance > 0

Amendment.Name: Chargeback Cancellation
Amendment.EffectiveDate: {% if Data.Workflow.ExecutionDate > Data.Subscription.SubscriptionEndDate %}{{ Data.Subscription.SubscriptionEndDate }}{% else %}{{ Data.Workflow.ExecutionDate }}{% endif %}

parameters.where_clause: Id = '{{ Data.InvoiceItem | map: "SubscriptionId" | join: "' OR Id = '"}}' AND Status = 'Active'

parameters.where_clause: Invoice.Balance > 0 AND Invoice.DueDate < 'today - 10 day' AND Invoice.Status = 'Posted' AND Subscription.Status ='Active'  Limit 1

parameters.where_clause: Subscription.Status = 'Suspended' AND SubscriptionVersionAmendment.SuspendDate < 'today' AND Account.Balance = 0 Limit 1

fields.instruction: This is a sample workflow provided by Zuora without any expressed guarantees whatsoever. Customer can take this as a starting point to build their own version of a workflow to achieve the desired results. Zuora is not responsible nor provides support for the execution of this workflow within any of the Customer's tenants including, but not limited to Sandbox, Production, PCE

CSV file with the required column of "Subscription: Name". Other columns are optional, but ignored.
....................................**FILE CAN BE EMPTY, so all applicable Subs will be effected**
Name of the specific recurring discount to apply. Alternative for this example is "Goodwill Discount - Fixed"

True: uses FixedPeriod option to end the discount. 
False: uses SubscriptionEnd option to end the discount.
If using FixedPeriod for EndDateCondition, leave as 0 to use the discount's definition, or override to a positive integer for a specific number of billing periods as per the definition.
Leave blank to make the amendment effective today, or specify a future date.

If you enter a contractEffectiveDate into the future, that falls AFTER the current Term End Date of a target Subscription, the Workflow will switch the amendment to the Term End Date for that Subscription. 
BUT if you want to skip over and NOT amend the target Subscription, then you MUST enter the word SKIP in this parameter.
False: Executes amendments. True: Prepares Amendments for up to 5 Subs, but DOES NOT execute them

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Values > 1 would be used to stretch the interval time between retries.
Values < 1 would actually shrink the interval between retries. Example, 1.5

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Initial number of the interval minutes to wait between retries. As retries increase the wait time would change as well according to the backOffMultiplier. Example, 5

tasks.name: Retrieve the RatePlan for Input Discount
NewProduct Amendment for Goodwill discount on '{{Data.LinkData.Name}}'
Retrieve the RatePlanCharge for Input Discount
Executing on Orders feature? (Failure message will tell us)
Determine what type of tenant we are executing under

parameters.emailBody:
Action is needed to review a non-paying customer
 

Please review an account for suspension

The account AccountName (AccountNumber) has progressed through the dunning process and now should be suspended.

They have 100$ outstanding on the account.

Actions

Click here to approve if you've suspended the customer - the customer will be sent an email asking for payment to be reactivated.

Click here to reject if you aren't suspending immediately - the customer will still be sent an email asking for the outstanding balance but will be told they won't be immediately suspended.

About this notice

This notice is sent automatically by the Collections and Dunning workflow in Zuora.

For support or to alter this notice, contact the IT servicedesk, mentioning the suspension approval notice from Zuora and the template code below.

© Zzoomm plc 2023. Registered in England. Company number 11738914.

Registered address: Zzoomm plc C/O Gowlings WLG, 4 More London Riverside, London, SE1 2AU. This email was generated from template F8CB2.

inputFields.instruction: This is a sample workflow provided by Zuora without any expressed guarantees whatsoever. Customer can take this as a starting point to build their own version of a workflow to achieve the desired results. Zuora is not responsible nor provides support for the execution of this workflow within any of the Customer's tenants including, but not limited to Sandbox, Production, PCE

CSV file with the required column of "Subscription: Name". Other columns are optional, but ignored.
....................................**FILE CAN BE EMPTY, so all applicable Subs will be effected**
Name of the specific recurring discount to apply. Alternative for this example is "Goodwill Discount - Fixed"
Apply discount to recurring charges?
Apply discount to usage charges?
Apply discount to one-time charges?

True: uses FixedPeriod option to end the discount. 
False: uses SubscriptionEnd option to end the discount.
If using FixedPeriod for EndDateCondition, leave as 0 to use the discount's definition, or override to a positive integer for a specific number of billing periods as per the definition.
Leave blank to make the amendment effective today, or specify a future date.

If you enter a contractEffectiveDate into the future, that falls AFTER the current Term End Date of a target Subscription, the Workflow will switch the amendment to the Term End Date for that Subscription. 
BUT if you want to skip over and NOT amend the target Subscription, then you MUST enter the word SKIP in this parameter.
False: Executes amendments. True: Prepares Amendments for up to 5 Subs, but DOES NOT execute them

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Values > 1 would be used to stretch the interval time between retries.
Values < 1 would actually shrink the interval between retries. Example, 1.5

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Initial number of the interval minutes to wait between retries. As retries increase the wait time would change as well according to the backOffMultiplier. Example, 5

BUT if you want to skip over and NOT amend the target Subscription, then you MUST enter the word SKIP in this parameter.
False: Executes amendments. True: Prepares Amendments for up to 5 Subs, but DOES NOT execute them

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Values > 1 would be used to stretch the interval time between retries.
Values < 1 would actually shrink the interval between retries. Example, 1.5

Used internally to retry external running tasks that may glitch: Initial number of the interval minutes to wait between retries. As retries increase the wait time would change as well according to the backOffMultiplier. Example, 5
